section.section: The Secretary shall appoint the executive director of the Commission from a list of 3 nominees submitted by the Commission.
The executive director serves at the pleasure of the Secretary.

text.section:
The executive director shall:
possess a broad knowledge of generally accepted practices in the real estate business in the State; and
be reasonably well informed of the general laws that govern agency and contracts for the conveyance or leasing of real estate.

section.section: The executive director shall devote full time to the duties of office.

The executive director may not hold any position or engage in another business that:
interferes with the position of executive director; or
might conflict with the position of executive director.

While employed by the Commission, the executive director may not:
be licensed in any state as a real estate broker, an associate real estate broker, or a real estate salesperson;
engage in any act for which a license is required under this title; or
in connection with any real estate transaction, directly or indirectly receive or become entitled to receive any fee, perquisite, or compensation.

text.section:
The executive director is entitled to:
compensation in accordance with the State budget; and
reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
The executive director is a special appointment in the State Personnel Management System.
While employed as executive director, the executive director shall be covered by a surety bond in the form and amount required by law.
